t: To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
How*pn long, O Lord?*s Will you forget me forever? How*ld long will you hide your face from me?
How*ln long must I take counsel in my soul and*ld have sorrow in my heart all the day? How*ln long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
Consider*pn and answer me, O Lord*s my God; light*ld up my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death,
lest*ln my enemy say, “I have prevailed over him,” lest*ld my foes rejoice because I am shaken.
But*pn I have trusted in your steadfast love; my*ld heart shall rejoice in your salvation.
I*ln will sing to the Lord,*s because*ld he has dealt bountifully with me.
